title: Ticket #5455: HTCondor View: Fix edit and fullscreen for multi-URL charts
description:
The edit and fullscreen pages aren't prepared to cope with charts that are drawing from multiple URLs. They both expect a singular URL. Also, they have no comprehension of date ranges, so given a URL like "data/submitters.weekly..json", they don't know how to expand it.

There are two possible solutions

Option 1: edit/fullscreen should support multiple URLs

1. Teach edit.html and fullscreen.html that there might be multiple URLs and to preserve them all. This may require an HTCondorView API change to allow data_url to be a list. That will require changes at several layers (and might forbid using date range expansion in this case? It could be made to work, but seems silly.).

2. Teach HTCondorView that links to edit and fullscreen should include all URLs used.

Option 2: edit/fullscreen should support date ranges

1. Teach edit.html and fullscreen.html to accept and use date ranges. Hopefully a relatively shallow change limited to edit and fullscreen.

2. Teach HTCondorView that links to edit and fullscreen should include the date ranges if present.

Option 2 is probably easier and arguably more clear about intent.
remarks:
2015-Dec-23 17:21:24 by adesmet:
Going with option 2. fullscreen already fixed.

2016-Jan-04 13:20:29 by adesmet:
Fixed edit. The UI is clunky, but serviceable; it's not really intended for casual use.

Both cases resolved. Ticket resolved.
